news.title: FC Platinum forward Thandolwenkosi Ngwenya joins South Africa Premiership side Amazulu
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

FC Platinum striker Thandolwenkosi Ngwenya has agreed to join South Africas Betway Premiership side Amazulu, NewZimbabwe.com has learnt.

Ngwenya charmed Usuthu during the 2025 mens Confederation of Southern African Football Association (COSAFA) Cup, which was played this month in South Africa.During the tournament, Ngwenya scored two goals and made it into the COSAFA Cup tourney team of the first round, only to be limited by Zimbabwes early exit.According to sources, the 22-year-old forward has signed a two year contract with Amazulu, which will see him at the club until June 2027.Usuthu won Ngwenyas signature ahead of local money bags side Scottland, who were also linked to the player and had bid a lucrative offer.Meanwhile, Saturday fixture between FC Platinum and Simba Bhora will be the last match for Ngwenya in green colours of Pure Platinum Play.

Ngwenya charmed Usuthu during the 2025 mens Confederation of Southern African Football Association (COSAFA) Cup, which was played this month in South Africa.

During the tournament, Ngwenya scored two goals and made it into the COSAFA Cup tourney team of the first round, only to be limited by Zimbabwes early exit.According to sources, the 22-year-old forward has signed a two year contract with Amazulu, which will see him at the club until June 2027.Usuthu won Ngwenyas signature ahead of local money bags side Scottland, who were also linked to the player and had bid a lucrative offer.Meanwhile, Saturday fixture between FC Platinum and Simba Bhora will be the last match for Ngwenya in green colours of Pure Platinum Play.

According to sources, the 22-year-old forward has signed a two year contract with Amazulu, which will see him at the club until June 2027.

Usuthu won Ngwenyas signature ahead of local money bags side Scottland, who were also linked to the player and had bid a lucrative offer.Meanwhile, Saturday fixture between FC Platinum and Simba Bhora will be the last match for Ngwenya in green colours of Pure Platinum Play.

Usuthu won Ngwenyas signature ahead of local money bags side Scottland, who were also linked to the player and had bid a lucrative offer.

Meanwhile, Saturday fixture between FC Platinum and Simba Bhora will be the last match for Ngwenya in green colours of Pure Platinum Play.

By Sports Reporter FC Platinum striker Thandolwenkosi Ngwenya has agreed to join South Africa’s Betway Premiership side Amazulu, NewZimbabwe.com has learnt. Ngwenya charmed Usuthu during the 2025 men’s Confederation of Southern African Football Association (COSAFA) Cup, which was played this month in South Africa. news.title: Former RBZ governor takes dig at IMF, calls for resilient African institutions
news.content:
By Alois Vinga

FORMER Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe (RBZ) governor John Mangudya says the International Monetary Fund (IMF) must ensure equitable disbursements of funds towards Africa inorder for it to make a meaningful impact.

He made the remarks during a panel discussion at the Afreximbank 2025 Annual Meetings, which were held in Abuja, Nigeria from June 25 and ended yesterday.The former central bank governor and current Mutapa Investment Fund CEO was proffering possible solutions on how the African regional blocs and financial institutions can enforce a resilient financial architecture.These institutions should be catalysts of development by deploying resources equitably. I did not say fairly, I said equitably because the International Monetary Fund (IMF) tells us that in 2021 they distributed their funds fairly, wherein Africa received US$33,3 billion against a pocket size of US$650 billion, he said.Mangudya said the disbursements made to Africa amounted to 5% of the special drawing rights (SDRs), a reality which contradicted the fact that Africa required the money much more than the Western high income countries.As a result of that inequitable distribution, those countries cannot use those funds and, therefore, they are now talking about the reallocation of the SDRs. It means that in the first place those funds were not equitably disbursed so thats why there is need for our institutions to ensure equitable distribution of funds, he said.The seasoned banker said in order to achieve a resilient financial architecture across the continent there is need for local institutions to work together towards the common agenda backed by a relevant ecosystem.He said the shareholders and the users of the funds must place Africas growth by investing in value addition and curbing the export of raw materials.Africas institutions must provide de-risking instruments such as guarantees, political risk insurance, credit enhancement and concessional funding, added Mangudya.

He made the remarks during a panel discussion at the Afreximbank 2025 Annual Meetings, which were held in Abuja, Nigeria from June 25 and ended yesterday.

The former central bank governor and current Mutapa Investment Fund CEO was proffering possible solutions on how the African regional blocs and financial institutions can enforce a resilient financial architecture.These institutions should be catalysts of development by deploying resources equitably. I did not say fairly, I said equitably because the International Monetary Fund (IMF) tells us that in 2021 they distributed their funds fairly, wherein Africa received US$33,3 billion against a pocket size of US$650 billion, he said.Mangudya said the disbursements made to Africa amounted to 5% of the special drawing rights (SDRs), a reality which contradicted the fact that Africa required the money much more than the Western high income countries.As a result of that inequitable distribution, those countries cannot use those funds and, therefore, they are now talking about the reallocation of the SDRs. It means that in the first place those funds were not equitably disbursed so thats why there is need for our institutions to ensure equitable distribution of funds, he said.The seasoned banker said in order to achieve a resilient financial architecture across the continent there is need for local institutions to work together towards the common agenda backed by a relevant ecosystem.He said the shareholders and the users of the funds must place Africas growth by investing in value addition and curbing the export of raw materials.Africas institutions must provide de-risking instruments such as guarantees, political risk insurance, credit enhancement and concessional funding, added Mangudya.

news.title: From Los Angeles red carpet to US Embassy talks, Madam Boss secures key partnership
news.content:
By Staff Reporter

LOVE her or hate her, Zimbabwean socialite and 2021 E! Peoples Choice Award for African Social Star, Madam Boss is undeniably on a roll.

Fresh from the recently held glitz and glamour of the BET Awards in Los Angeles, the comedian has now sealed a partnership with the U.S. Embassy in Harare, Zimbabwe, which will see her opening doors for the Zimbabwean entertainment industry.

Madam Boss, real name Tyra Chikocho, wasted no time upon her return, heading straight to the U.S. Embassys Public Diplomacy suite, accompanied by her husband, Ngoni Munetsiwa.

The US Embassy announced her visit in a Facebook post, about her independently earned U.S. experiences.

From the Black Entertainment Television (BET) Awards red carpet to our Public Diplomacy suite  E! Peoples Choice Award winner Madam Boss briefed us on her independently earned U.S. experiences and outlined plans to grow the business of comedy in Zimbabwe. We appreciate her insights and collaboration. Thanks for stopping by!, said the US Embassy in Zimbabwe

In response to the US Embassy post, Madam Boss, revealed the collaboration with the embassy.

Thank you for the invite and as discussed we greatly appreciate your pledge to support and collaborate with the Madam Boss Brand through our Madam Boss Foundation and all our business initiatives- thank you, the future is great, she responded.

Madam Boss recent BET Awards attendance sparked criticisms from people on social media, a sentiment which was swiftly challenged by Earground founder, Plot Mhako, who urged critics, The hate Madam Boss is getting from some Zimbos for being at the BET Awards is wild. If its that easy, go ahead and do it yourself.

Until then, let her live her moment in peace. Success isnt easy  lets support those bold enough to chase it, he wrote.
news.description:
By Staff Reporter  LOVE her or hate her, Zimbabwean socialite and 2021 E! People’s Choice Award for African Social Star, Madam Boss is undeniably on a roll. Fresh from the recently held glitz and glamour of the BET Awards in Los Angeles, the comedian has now sealed a partnership with the U.S. Embassy in Harare,

The post From Los Angeles red carpet to US Embassy talks, Madam Boss secures key partnership  appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

news.title: Zimbabwean businessman seeks declarator Zambian Court of Appeal acted unconstitutionally as 26-year-old legal battle drags on
news.content:
By Mary Taruvinga

A ZIMBABWEAN businessman has filed a Constitutional Court application seeking a declarator that the judges of the Court of Appeal of Zambia breached that countrys Constitution by failing to abide by the wishes of the Zambian people.

Jayesh Shah contends that it is common knowledge that the Constitution of a country is what the people decide how their country should be governed and laws made by Parliament flow from the that supreme law.

Shah in 2022, who after 24 years in court, won a US$139 million claim against the Bank of Zambia has now approached the Constitutional Court of Zambia seeking recourse after the Zambian Court of Appeal, in their 15 January 2024 ruling, held that court orders have to be obeyed until that order has been set aside.

However, the same court of appeal acted contrary to their own pronouncement of the law as they themselves did not abide by what they held and went ahead to set aside the High Court order which the Bank of Zambia had not appealed against.

The High Court on September 29, 2022, had ordered Bank of Zambia to pay 30% into court before appealing.

But the Bank of Zambia, Shah complains breached a court order directing it to pay the 30% into court before appealing.

Shah has now petitioned the Constitutional Court of Zambia complaining that the Court of Appeal exceeded its appellant jurisdiction when it entertained an issue which was not appealed against in breach of article 131 of the Constitution and also violates the well- established legal principle of finality to litigation

Shah, who has vast business interests in Zimbabwe, Zambia and India among other countries, successfully sued the Zambian Central bank with the judge who presided over the case Justice Edward Luputa Musona describing the back-and-forth applications caused by the Bank of Zambia as an abuse of court processes.

Shah and his company AL Shams Building Materials were the applicants in the main matter he won three years ago.

In the present case at the Constitutional Court, Shah is seeking a declaration that he is also entitled to protection of the law and in addition a declaration that the Zambia Court of Appeal Judges breached the Constitution and went against their oath as judges.

Shah also sought a relief of a declaration that the court of appeal breached Article 119 of the Constitution by finding that the Bank of Zambia had disobeyed High Court order, yet the central bank never appealed against that order and went ahead to award costs against Bank of Zambia for disobedience of High Court order.

Shah also alleges that the court of appeal breached Article 118 of the Constitution by not acting in a just manner and such actions of the Court of Appeal do not promote accountability as stated in the Constitution.

Finally, Shah alleges that Court of Appeal breached Article 120 of the Constitution as the Court of Appeal did not abide by its own rules which categorically state that they shall only deal with issues which complained and stated in the Memorandum of Appeal.

The background is that on September 29, 2022, the High Court of Zambia rendered judgment in favour of Shah in sum of US$139,191,386.74 and granted the bank conditional leave to appeal, subject to the deposit of thirty percent (30%) of the judgment sum into the court within the stipulated period within which an appeal was to be lodged.

Despite the condition, the bank proceeded to file a Notice of Appeal and Memorandum of Appeal (with 7 grounds of appeal) on 11th October 2022 before the Court of Appeal of Zambia without complying with the High Courts directive to deposit the required money into court mentioned above, reads his latest petition.

Furthermore, the bank did not, at any point, challenge the legality or propriety of the conditional leave to appeal.

On October 11, 2022, the bank successfully obtained a stay of proceedings in the High Court Cause No. 2020/HPC/0565 pending the determination of the appeal in the Court of Appeal.

Shah maintains that the issues he raises are of public importance and warrant determination by the Constitutional Court pursuant to Article 1(5), which mandates that matters relating to the Constitution be heard by the Constitutional Court.

He prays for declaratory relief and such other remedies as the Constitutional Court may deem fit in the circumstances.
news.description:
By Mary Taruvinga  A ZIMBABWEAN businessman has filed a Constitutional Court application seeking a declarator that the judges of the Court of Appeal of Zambia breached that country’s Constitution by failing to abide by the wishes of the Zambian people. Jayesh Shah contends that it is common knowledge that the Constitution of a country is

The post Zimbabwean businessman seeks declarator Zambian Court of Appeal acted unconstitutionally as 26-year-old legal battle drags on appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

news.title: Dynamos coach Chaminuka returns to Kariba reminiscent of a 0-5 thrashing
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

THE last time Saul Chaminuka visited Nyamhunga Stadium in Kariba was on the 12th of April this year leading his former club Kwekwe United.

For obvious reasons, it is a match that he would want to forget because he lost 0-5, probably the heaviest defeat in his lengthy career as a coach in the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League (PSL).This Saturday, the soft spoken gaffer returns to Nyamhunga Stadium in the resort town, leading Dynamos who are set for a date against Kauya Katuruturu as ZPC Kariba are affectionately known.Without any doubt, this will give him a reminiscence of his previous nightmarish visit with Kwekwe United.All eyes will be on Chaminuka to see if he can do the revenge, something he is quite confident about.I played Kariba this season with Kwekwe and they gave us a thrashing, but I think I also learned a lot of things in that game.I have confidence that we will be able to go around if we can not go over what would be obstacles in that game.One thing l know is we are going to score in that game and again l think our biggest undoing is after scoring we are planning to maintain the lead, said Chaminuka.Dembare walks into the match at the back of an abandoned match against FC Platinum at Mandava Stadium this past Sunday.The abandonment of the match was forced by Dynamos, who walked off the pitch in protest over the the penalty, which the referee awarded FC Platinum.The former Black Rhinos gaffer believes he has to work on the mentality of his boys so that they shift from the Mandava incident to Saturdays clash.Its something that we should be able to be going over now. Its not a question of fitness, but I think the mental aspect.Since we started training , we have been trying to address that, added Chaminuka.Dynamos is currently swimming in the relegation zone, occupying position 16 on the log with 14 points, six places from bottom-placed Kwekwe United with eight points.
